holidays.name: Independence Day
holidays.description: A federal holiday commemorating the Declaration of Independence of the United States, signed in 1776.
holidays.origin: The Fourth of July has been a federal holiday since 1941, but the tradition of Independence Day celebrations dates back to the American Revolution.
tips: Plan outdoor activities early to avoid peak heat
Secure viewing spots for fireworks in advance
Consider food safety in hot weather

holidays.name: Thanksgiving
holidays.description: A national holiday celebrating the harvest and blessings of the past year.
holidays.origin: The first Thanksgiving was celebrated by the Pilgrims after their first harvest in the New World in 1621.

holidays.name: Christmas
holidays.description: A Christian holiday celebrating the birth of Jesus Christ, widely celebrated by both religious and non-religious people.
holidays.origin: Christmas has been celebrated since the 4th century, combining Christian traditions with various cultural customs.
